words.definition: An accessory is a thing that is added to another thing to make it look better.
words.example: The store sold colorful accessories like bags and sunglasses.

words.definition: An acquisition is something that a person buys or gets in some way.
words.example: Marty was happy with his new acquisition: a very fast bicycle.

words.definition: When something is adequate, it is good enough for something else.
words.example: Without adequate notice, they will have to turn around.

words.definition: Cardboard is a material made out of thick paper.
words.example: The heavy boxes were made of cardboard.

words.definition: A dilemma is a situation in which you have to make a difficult choice.
words.example: The girl had a dilemma: should she stay home or go to the party?

words.definition: When something is elaborate, it has a lot of details and parts.
words.example: The cook made an elaborate meal for the guests.

words.definition: To facilitate something means to make it easier for it to happen.
words.example: The new law will facilitate more trade between the two countries.

words.definition: A fleet is a group of ships or vehicles that are controlled by one person or organization.
words.example: The company has a fleet of delivery trucks.

words.definition: A grid is a pattern of straight lines that cross each other.
words.example: The streets of the city were laid out in a grid pattern.

words.definition: To import something means to bring it into a country from another country.
words.example: The country imports a lot of oil from its neighbors.

words.definition: To infer something means to decide that it is true based on information that you have.
words.example: From the evidence, the police inferred that the man was guilty.

words.definition: To inflate something means to fill it with air or gas.
words.example: The boy used a pump to inflate his bicycle tires.

words.definition: When something is innate, it is a quality that you are born with.
words.example: He has an innate ability to play the piano.

words.definition: Marble is a hard type of rock that is used for making statues and buildings.
words.example: The floor of the palace was made of white marble.

words.definition: A mast is a tall pole on a boat that holds the sails.
words.example: The ship’s mast was broken in the storm.

words.definition: Nausea is the feeling that you are going to vomit.
words.example: The smell of the food gave her a feeling of nausea.

words.definition: When something is naval, it relates to a country’s navy.
words.example: The country has a strong naval force to protect its coast.

words.definition: A pouch is a small bag or pocket.
words.example: The kangaroo carries its baby in its pouch.

words.definition: When something is saturated, it is completely wet or filled with something.
words.example: The ground was saturated with water after the heavy rain.

words.definition: When something is updated, it is made more modern.
words.example: The computer program has been updated with new features.
